item.description:
Images Images are made up of multiple layers that get stacked on top of each other and represented as a single object. Inside of the image is a cut-down OS and all of the files and dependencies required to run an application. Images are like stopped containers.We can stop a container and create a new …

item.title: Docker Part-II: History
item.dc:creator: kaushik
item.description:
How container arrive? In the past used to run only one application per server (Windows/Linux) as didn’t have the technologies to safely and securely run multiple applications on the same server.VM was a game changer.But VM requires dedicated OS is a major flaw. Every OS consumes CPU, RAM and storage that could otherwise be used …

item.title: Service Virtualization/Virtualisation
item.dc:creator: kaushik
item.description:
In Service virtualisation we emulate the behavior of specific components in heterogeneous component-based applications such as API-driven applications, cloud-based applications and service-oriented architectures. This method is used to test Monolithe application. Say the component under test has dependency on other component. But due to some reason (like Not yet completed,Still evolving, Controlled by a third-party …

item.title: Testing Microservices
item.dc:creator: kaushik
item.description:
Differennces between Monolithe and Microservice Architecture Microservice architecture relies more on over-the-wire (remote) dependencies and less on in-process components We need to manage the interdependent components in order to test microservices in a cost and time effective way. We can use test doubles that pretend to be real dependencies for the purpose of the test. …
